subject: RE: [junit] JUnit precursors
msgSnippet: I wrote the original testing framework in ~1994 in Smalltalk. The framework I wrote did not have a name until after JUnit came out. Kent Beck Three Rivers
messageBody:
I wrote the original testing framework in ~1994 in Smalltalk. The framework I wrote did not have a name until after JUnit came out.

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Elliotte Harold
> Sent: Friday, July 29, 2005 10:19 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] JUnit precursors
>
> I'm fact checking for an article I'm writing.
>
> I vaguely recall that when Beck and Gamma invented JUnit on
> that famous
> transatlantic trip, they were inspired by some preexisting
> framework in
> SmallTalk. Is that accurate? Does anyone remember what that
> precursor to
> JUnit was?
>
> --
